transportAdvice: Austin has a public bus network that covers most tourist areas, though service can be infrequent and the city is largely car-oriented. Walking is practical in dense neighborhoods like downtown and South Congress, but a taxi or ride-hail service is generally needed to move between districts efficiently.

weather.description: Mild but cool winters with occasional cold fronts and light rain; layers are advisable.
Temperatures begin to warm slightly but cold spells and rain remain possible.
Pleasant spring weather arrives with warming days, though thunderstorms can develop.
Warm and often stormy; April is one of the wetter months with frequent afternoon thunderstorms.
Hot and humid with a high chance of heavy thunderstorms; outdoor plans should account for afternoon rain.
Summer heat sets in with long sunny days and relatively dry conditions; stay hydrated outdoors.
The hottest month of the year with intense sun and very little rain; limit midday outdoor activity.
Equally hot as July with dry, sunny conditions; swimming holes and air-conditioned venues are popular escapes.
Heat begins to ease slightly and rain chances increase as fall approaches; still warm and sunny overall.
One of the most pleasant months with comfortable temperatures and colorful foliage beginning to appear.
Mild and crisp autumn weather with occasional rain; a great time to enjoy outdoor festivals and dining.
Cool and occasionally cold with light rain; festive holiday atmosphere in the city center.
